page.title: 03RECREATION
page.content: Mr. Hall works for Colonel Stanton as a gamekeeper.When breeding pheasants he puts the eggs firstly into the incubator two hundred in each tray.When they have been in for two or three weeks he takes them out and puts them in a crisp box until they are about five weeks old. They are then put into the pens that are made for them and live there till they are fully grown,then they go into the woods.When the chicks are in the pen they eat pellets from a bowl under a shelter and they drink water.They flint grit,that is there teeth,because it cuts up the food they eat.The Colonel organises the shoots,but the gamekeeper makes the places to shoot from Mr.Hall has got three dogs,two geese,four hens and five sheep.
